result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaneika M Joshua was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Restitution due within the first 90 days of supervision.     
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Ct's 9-12: Court costs are due during term of supervision.     
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
No contact with victim A.C. or co-defendant

timeConds.notes:
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08.
Submit to DNA sample upon report date for jail time.
Defendant to report to the Jail on Friday, June 10th, 2016 at 05:00 pm.  Defendant to be released from Jail at 06:30 am on the following Monday.  This pattern is to continue over consecutive weekends until the 30 Days Jail time has been served.  Calculations of time served to be made by the Ozaukee County Jail.

Sentencing document filed by the State

Defendant Shaneika M Joshua in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Recommendation given by the State. Statement by defendant's mother and defendant. Court renders sentence.
Sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Stipulation/Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits.
4/28/2016 Trial    Paper exhibits destroyed as of 05/15/2018.
Preliminary Jury Instructions
Voir Dire

State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in person and by Atty Martin Tanz.  Motions before trial.  Counsel moves for an adjournment.  Court orders matter to proceed to trial.
  9:45 am Jury sworn and called to jury box
  9:49 am Voir Dire by the Court
  9:58 am Voir Dire by the State
10:14 am Voir Dire by the Defense
10:40 am Striking of jury
10:46 am Jury panel selected; remaining jurors thanked and excused
10:48 am Jury panel sworn
10:48 am Preliminary instructions by the Court
10:55 am Opening by the State
11:03 am Opening by the Defense
11:11 am Jury excused from the courtroom.  Court makes record in regard to the side bar.  
11:17 am Recess of the Court
11:32 am Case recalled; same appearances.  Jury called in.
11:35 am Testimony by A.C.
12:31 pm Jury excused for lunch.  Housekeeping matters by the Court.
12:35 pm  Court stands in recess until 1:30 pm.

  1:40 pm/dk   Atty. Tanz informs the Court he believes a witness has violated the sequestration order. Court questions witness. Court does not find witness violated sequestration order. 
  1:45 pm   Jury in court. L.D. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Sisley, crossexam by Atty. Tanz. 
  2:00 pm   Officer Christopher Erickson sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Sisley, crossexam by Atty. Tanz, redirect, recross. 
  2:25 pm   State rests subject to rebuttal. Defense reserves ruling on defendant's motion. 
  2:28 pm   M. A. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Tanz, crossexam by Atty. Sisley. 
  2:35 pm   Jury excused. Atty. Tanz states defendant will testify. Court colluqy with defendant as to her testimony. 
  2:37 pm   Court/counsel recess.
  2:50 pm   Court/counsel jury instruction conference held.
  3:00 pm   Atty. Tanz motion to dismiss. Court denies motion. 
  3:01 pm   Defendant, Shaneika Joshua,  sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Tanz, crossexam by Atty. Sisley, redirect.
  3:10 pm   Defense rests. 
  3:11 pm   No rebuttal testimony.
  3:12 pm   Court instructs jury.
  3:30 pm   Closing statement by Atty. Sisley.
  3:40 pm   Closing statement by Atty. Tanz.
  3:52 pm   Rebuttal statement by Atty. Sisley.  
  3:56 pm   Court further instructs jury.
  3:57 pm   Bailiff sworn.
  3:58 pm   Jury leaves for deliberation. 
  5:08 pm   Court is informed jury has reached a verdict.
  5:13 pm   Court/counsel/jury/defendant present in Court. Atty. Adam Gerol in Court for Atty. Jeffrey Sisley. Verdict Read: Ct. 9-Guilty /  Ct. 10-Guilty  /  Ct. 11-Guilty  /  Ct. 12-Guilty
  5:15 pm   Jury polled.
  5:18 pm   Jury thanked and excused. 
                    State moves for judgment on the verdict, Atty. Tanz motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdict. Court orders judgment on the verdict be entered. 
                    Court adjourns sentencing to 5/12/2016 at 10:00 am. Defendant reminded of bail conditions.
Phone call from Defendant's atty requesting adjournment of 4/28/16 trial. Court denied request and matter will be heard as scheduled.
